thread.title: Teen needs six stitches after being ‘glassed’ in the head during footie ace Troy Deeney’s 3am nightclub brawl
thread.title_full: Teen needs six stitches after being ‘glassed’ in the head during footie ace Troy Deeney’s 3am nightclub brawl

author: ckerr1
title: Teen needs six stitches after being ‘glassed’ in the head during footie ace Troy Deeney’s 3am nightclub brawl
text:
Other Sports prem star's club shame Teen needs six stitches after being ‘glassed’ in the head during footie ace Troy Deeney’s 3am nightclub brawl 
James Hancox, 19, needed six stitches after the 3am fight started, he says, by the footie ace Exclusive by JAMES MILLS and BEN LEO 13th February 2017, 9:33 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A TEEN claims he was glassed in the head during a brawl that erupted around footie ace Troy Deeney and saw him thrown out of a nightclub. 
Carpenter James Hancox, 19, needed six stitches after the 3am fight — which he says started following a row with the Premier League striker. 6 The youngster suffered huge gash that needed stitches at Birmingham’s Queen Elizabeth Hospital 
He told pals that Deeney, 28, snatched his phone and refused to return it when he tried to take a picture of the Watford captain. 
One said: “There was a mass brawl and James ended up with a big gash on the back of his head. 
“He’s given a statement to police and it’s all on CCTV apparently.” Watford FC captain Troy Deeney threatened with pepper spray by cop The Sun told yesterday how Deeney was thrown out of the Birmingham club in the early hours of Sunday and threatened with pepper spray by police.
He denies attacking anyone and insists he is a victim, as he was punched by two men. 
The injured man’s friend said that Deeney, a lifelong Birmingham City fan, was in a bad mood after earlier being hassled by rival supporters of Aston Villa. He helped relegate Villa last season after scoring three times against them in two wins for Watford.
